items.sentence: Let\'s begin by considering the similarities.
Let\'s clean the entire office next Saturday.
Let\'s compare this dictionary with that one.
Let\'s discuss the plan over a cup of coffee.
Tom doesn\'t yet know what he\'s going to do.
Tom said he didn\'t have a driver\'s license.
Making pizza is something I learned from Tom.
I was trying to figure out why that happened.
I wish I had bought a ticket for the concert.
I wonder if Tom would really teach me French.
Tom didn\'t agree with Mary about the matter.
Tom didn\'t even get a chance to say goodbye.
My vet told me to feed my dog in the evening.
Nobody could remember the sequence of events.
Nobody knows what goes on behind those doors.
Nobody knows what happened to all that money.
Nobody told me it was going to get this cold.
He denied knowing anything about their plans.
He was seriously injured in the car accident.
He will be playing tennis tomorrow afternoon.
I didn\'t know that Tom was Mary\'s grandson.
Tom said he couldn\'t give us what we wanted.
I skipped out on my appointment with my boss.
I think that that book is not so interesting.
I think that what you need now is some sleep.
I assume you know how to get to Tom\'s house.
I can play chess, but I can\'t play checkers.
I can\'t believe Tom really plans to do that.
Let\'s get out of here before it\'s too late.
Isn\'t there something you want to say to me?
What did you do with all the money you stole?
What does the doctor think is wrong with Tom?
This is the first time I\'ve heard that word.
This is the third time I\'ve seen this movie.
This is where Tom stays when he\'s in Boston.
I wonder whether or not Tom has quit his job.
I wonder whether or not Tom really said that.
I wonder whether or not Tom will like Boston.
I wonder why Tom told me I needed to do that.
I wonder why tennis is played in mini-skirts.
I know it\'s highly unlikely anyone knows me.
I think Tom isn\'t the right man for the job.
What\'s the temperature going to be tomorrow?
What\'s your favorite kind of movie to watch?
What\'s your impression of the United States?
Tom and Mary got married on Valentine\'s Day.
Tom and Mary spent Valentine\'s Day together.
Tom and Mary\'s wedding anniversary is today.
School has closed for the Christmas holidays.
Shakespeare wrote a lot of interesting plays.
